.. _`cs-tasks-data`:

Data
===================================================================================================

Persistent (non-configuration) data:

- :ref:`cs-tasks-defaults` (for members of a common roles)
- :ref:`cs-tasks-settings` (for a single user)
- :ref:`cs-tasks-read` (for a single user and a single task)
- :ref:`cs-tasks-tags` (for a single user and a single task)


.. _`cs-tasks-defaults`:

Settings
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Please use the Powerscript module ``cs.taskmanager.settings`` to read and write user settings.

Default settings are provided as user settings for user ``cs.taskmanager.dflt`` for technical
reasons.

Application Settings
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Application-level settings for ``cs.taskmanager.web`` are stored as serialized JSON in
``cdb_setting`` using the keys ``setting_id = "cs.taskmanager"`` and ``setting_id2 = "settings"``.
The JSON data is expected to have the following keys and values:

- **size**: String, determines the width of the details area. Value has to be valid for the CSS
  property "width". Defaults to "40rem".
- **notificationInterval**: Integer, amount of milliseconds between checks for updated task data.


.. _`cs-tasks-column-settings`:

Column Settings
^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^

Table-level settings are stored in the same way using
``setting_id2 = "cs-taskmanager-web-tasks-table"``. They are maintained by the table component.


.. _`cs-tasks-settings`:

Personal Settings
---------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------

Personal settings have the same JSON schema as :ref:`cs-tasks-defaults`. They are stored in
``cdb_usr_setting``/``cdb_usr_setting_long_txt``.
